newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee adjusted down against the dollar.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee adjusted down against the dollar.

text.p: The State (central) Bank of Pakistan (SBP) on Saturday adjusted the rupee down to 40.4600/40.6623 to the dollar from 40.3900/40.5920 fixed on May 23, an SBP official said.
The central bank gave no reason for the action, but bankers said it was in line with the government's policy of adjusting the rupee's value to keep Pakistani exports competitive.
Bankers said the adjustment had been expected because the dollar had appreciated sharply against most other currencies.
"We expect a creeping downward adjustment of about 0.10 to 0.12 rupee against the dollar every month till December," one banker said.
"The Pakistani economy is passing through a difficult phase and this adjustment is no surprise to us in view to the widening trade deficit and strong dollar in the international market," he said.
The central bank has been pursuing a crawling peg depreciation policy to match the rupee to a basket of currencies.
